translated: Dickson, James Iwan Axel, Chamberlain, Member of Parliament, Vikaryd, Alingsås, b. 18/3/99 in Gothenburg to estate owner Axel D. and Nancy Bratt. Married 23 years to Vanja Bergh. Children: Maud b. 24, married in 1946 to Lieutenant Ghr. Söderhielm, Marianne b. 26, Birgitta b. 29, Archie J:son b. 33. — Graduated Lundsbergs sk. 1917, international flight certification 1917, army pilot training 1920, agricultural degree from Alnarp 1923. Started businesses and travelled extensively to several European countries, as well as North America, Asia, and Africa. Captain in the national guard in 1938, captain in the Finnish military in 1939-40, reserve officer captain in 1944. Chamberlain-in-waiting in 1928, served from 1935, appointed as Chamberlain in 1940. Owner of Vikaryds property. District councilor from 1935-38 and 43-46, member of the second chamber of parliament as Christian Democratic Party representative from 1941, chairman of the municipal meeting since 1927, municipal councilor from 1927-39 and since 1944, chairman of the municipal board from 1927-39, chairman of the church meeting in 1940 and other local assignments, chairman of the National Reserve Officers' Association from 1944-47, president of the Gothenburg Rotary Club from 1939-40. Knight of the Order of the Lion of Finland, Knight of the Order of the German Eagle with Swords, Commander of the French Legion of Honour, Swedish Freemason, Freemason of the Danish Order, Knight of the Order of the Polar Star, Member of the Alvsborg district shooting association, awarded by the Swedish Military Sports Association.
